required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

lead_sponsor.agency: Groupe Hospitalier de la Rochelle Ré Aunis

clinical_study.source: Groupe Hospitalier de la Rochelle Ré Aunis

brief_summary.textblock: Ischemic heart disease, or coronary heart disease, covers a set of pathologies due to insufficient oxygen supply to the myocardium due to the development of atherosclerosis in one or more coronary arteries. To evaluate the safety of angioplasty performed in patients operated on at La Rochelle Hospital, the rate of major adverse cardiac events (MACE) will be determined and compared with data from the literature.

detailed_description.textblock: The use of active stents for the treatment of coronary stenosis is currently the standard treatment in almost all types of coronary lesions. In percutaneous transluminal treatment of coronary lesions, balloon angioplasty and bare stents have not shown satisfactory results in the past. The so-called active drug-eluting balloon could represent a new therapeutic option for the treatment of de novo lesions.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of major adverse cardiac events (MACE)
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint is a composite endpoint that includes major adverse cardiac events defined as cardiovascular death, non-fatal myocardial infarction (MI), non-fatal stroke (stroke) and revascularization of target lesion (TLR) within 12 months of surgery.

intervention.description: Procedure used to open clogged heart arteries. Involves the insertion of a tiny balloon and/or a stent to widen the artery.

study_pop.textblock: Patients referred for coronary angiography for revascularization are those for whom a diagnosis of acute (Acute Coronary Syndrome with or without ST segment elevation) or chronic (Silent myocardial ischemia, angina) coronary pathology has been made

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Interventional revascularization of a coronary lesion,
- Member or beneficiary of a social security system,
- Informed of the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Language barrier,
- Minor,
- Pregnant woman,
- Person under guardianship,
- Person deprived of his/her liberty,
- Refusal to participate.

overall_official.affiliation: Groupe Hospitalier de la Rochelle Ré Aunis

facility.name: Groupe Hospitalier de la Rochelle Ré Aunis
